data.title: Phil Steele Names Larison; Connors And Kennedy FCS Preseason All
data.meta_description: Seniors running back Lan Larison (first team) and defensive lineman Zach Kennedy (third team) along with junior defensive back Rex Connors (third team) have all
data.text:
Football 8/2/2024 10:26:00 AM

Phil Steele Names Larison; Connors And Kennedy FCS Preseason All-Americans

DAVIS, Calif. â€“ Seniors running back Lan Larison (first team) and defensive lineman Zach Kennedy (third team) along with junior defensive back Rex Connors (third team) have all added another preseason national honor to their accolades as Phil Steele names all three UC Davis Aggies FCS Preseason All-Americans as part of Steele's Football Championship Series 2024 preview.

All three Aggies have already earned Preseason FCS All-American honors from Stats Perform and all three have been named to the Big Sky Preseason All-Conference team by both Phil Steele and the conference.

Named to the 2024 Walter Payton Award Preseason Watch List, Lan Larison has also been named and the Preseason Big Sky Offensive Player of the Year and he is one of five Big Sky student-athletes to be named to the Walter Payton Award Preseason Watch List.

HERO Sports also named him the nation's best returning running back as part of their 2024 FCS season preview.

Despite only playing in eight games due to injury, Larison finished 2023 with 1,101 rushing yards and 13 rushing touchdowns, placing him among the nation's best. He finished ranked 12th in the nation in rushing yards and rushing touchdowns and his 15 total touchdowns put him eighth in the country. And he led the conference in all-purpose yards (1,299) and finished second in the league in rushing yards and third in rushing touchdowns.

Named the 12th-best returning edge rusher in the nation by HERO Sports, Kennedy finished 2023 with 28 stops (18 solo, 10 assisted), breaking up two passes and registering four quarterback hurries. Against Montana, Kennedy blocked a kick and at Idaho State Kennedy was in the backfield all game, finishing with eight total tackles and getting three sacks.

Earlier in the week Connors was named to the Buck Buchanan Award Preseason Watch List, being named as one of the best 35 defenders in the nation.

The Aggie safety led the 2023 UC Davis secondary in total tackles (59) and solo tackles (36) finishing third and second on the team in both respective categories. He also added 2.5 tackles for loss, six pass break ups, one forced fumble and one interception.

He was named the seventh-best returning safety in the nation by HERO Sports. And among the top 30 returning safeties by HERO Sports, Connors ranks the highest among Big Sky colleagues sitting 11 spots higher than Northern Arizona's Alex McLaughlin, the next ranked Big Sky safety.

2024 FALL CAMP: UC Davis opens fall camp on July 31 and all practices are open to media and fans. The Aggies will split time between the grass of Bob Biggs Practice Field and the turf of UC Davis Health Stadium. Fans and media can watch the Aggies regardless of which field they are on.

Filming and photography are ALLOWED for all sessions of practice held on BOB BIGGS PRACTICE FIELD (grass-field). Filming and photography are PROHIBITED for all sessions of practice held on the UC DAVIS HEALTH STADIUM turf field.

Players and coach Plough will be available to the media in the Bruce Edwards Club Room following each practice. Specific times are listed on the fall camp schedule.

UC Davis opens the season at Cal on Aug. 31, with kick set for 2 p.m. The Aggies open UC Davis Health Stadium on Sept. 7 with a 7 p.m. kickoff against Texas A&M-Commerce.

Fans can buy season tickets, group tickets, mini plans, single game tickets and corporate ticket packages, by clicking the links or by calling the Aggie Ticket Office at (530) 752-2471 or by emailing aggietickets@ucdavis.edu.
